Drugs. 
     778. The disease which the drug was given to cure may disappear, but only to reappear in a new form, such as skin diseases, ulcers, painful, diseased joints, and sometimes in a more dangerous and deadly form. The liver, heart, and brain are frequently affected by drugs, and often all these organs 
                                                                           186
are burdened with disease. . . . These organs, which should be in healthy condition, are enfeebled, and the blood becomes impure.--H. to L., Chap. 3, p. 61.
